revised_title: Horseford Ground Sinking Phenomenon and Thunderstorm
tldr: A violent thunderstorm occurred in Norwich, and the following day, a piece of ground at Horseford, Norfolk, sank down. The area had a firm and solid appearance with no visible cracks or chasms. The soil composition consisted of cornmould earth and brown and yellow sand in different strata. The cause of the phenomenon remains unexplained.
